events.name: Stream Big Book Launch
events.description:
Nathan Grayson, author of Stream Big: The Triumphs And Turmoils Of Twitch And The Stars Behind The Screen, is joined by Aftermath's Gita Jackson and Chris Person and Polygon's Simone de Rochefort for a discussion of the Amazon-owned livestreaming platform's place in modern gaming culture and beyond.
How did a website dedicated to watching people play video games grow into a force that has attracted attention from mainstream stars and politicians? What kind of work actually goes into being a popular Twitch streamer? Is it really as simple as sitting down in front of a camera and playing your favorite game? (No, absolutely not.) And how does one even begin to cover that as a journalist and write a book that encapsulates it all, especially when the world of livestreaming never stops, not even for a moment?
Come for answers to all of these questions and stay for never-before-told stories about your favorite/least favorite streamers.
rsvp

events.name: Deck 2 Deck
events.description:
Berlin’s Finest lands in New York on Feb 16th!
Join us as we bring the Big Apple to life with a juicy plate of Currywurst. Get ready for a sweet Sunday filled with delicious funk, disco & boogie beats straight from Germany’s capital. Only Vinyl allowed!
Lineup
Carl Hang is a Berlin-based artist who has been making waves in the music scene with his dynamic blend of Disco, Boogie and Ghetto Tech Music.
Link:
https://soundcloud.com/deck2deck-records/carl-hang-humboldthain-club-230224
DJ Business, head of operations and bass aficionado, convinces with mind-boggling breaks and bassy bootyshakers. Truly a feast for your hips.
Link:
https://soundcloud.com/emotionalvoyagerecords/mixed-feelings-017-dj-business
Wall Ra's critically acclaimed playstyle runs right through an audience. Based in Rap, Funk, and Disco, his sets redefine the mainstream perception of dance music and leave audiences screaming for more.
Link:
https://soundcloud.com/wallra187/sets/for-the-listeners
The dancefloor heat will be served by none other than the three masterminds of Deck 2 Deck so come and join us for that extra dose of Funk!

events.name: Intro to Self-Defense Workshop
events.description:
Join us for a free intro self-defense workshop at Wonderville!
We’ll be covering the basics: stretching, conditioning, technique, and theory, with the hope that participants will leave with some super useful foundations that they can add to their self-defense toolkits.
Mix that in with movement and pad-hitting and you’ll have an accessible and confidence-boosting good time for all. This workshop is great for beginners, meant to share some simple-to-pick-up techniques that you can practice on your own or with friends!

venue.address: Wonderville 1186 Broadway Brooklyn, NY, 11221 United States

events.name: Robot Karaoke
events.description:
Join us for karaoke night on impossible mode as we replace the lyrics to any SONG with words from any TEXT, then try to sing the results on the spot.  It all happens live, so each song has never been heard before and will never be heard again.
Our songwriting system, THE WEIRD ALGORITHM, matches each line syllable-for-syllable, so you can sing along if you know the original tune.
Request any of the 100+ songs and 50+ texts in the catalog. Sign up to sing as an individual or a group...or sit back and watch the karaoke carnage.
Past combos include:
YELP REVIEWS OF PSYCHICS to the tune of TOTAL ECLIPSE OF THE HEART
CRAIGSLIST VEHICLE ADS to the tune of TAKE ME HOME COUNTRY ROADS
NEGATIVE REVIEWS OF PROFESSORS to the tune of VAMPIRE
BERNIE SANDERS EMAIL SUBJECT LINES to the tune of DON'T STOP BELIEVIN'
Hosted by Jamie Brew and Jenn Schiffer, two tech entrepreneurs on a mission to make karaoke harder and worse.
Free admission
Suggested donation - $10

venue.address: Wonderville 1186 Broadway Brooklyn, NY, 11221 United States

events.name: ONE DAY ONLY: Self-Help, PotCell, Golder on 3.13
events.description:
Self-help is a group with a singular brand of indie pop rock. Their explosive energy and infectious grooves bring audiences to life with a performance that is highly engaging and a sound that’s hard to pin down.
https://open.spotify.com/album/63IbJHpttefy5jEDzuLj3D?si=Bx-dHDcCRz68NRru6HFhmw
Powerhouse of The Cell began as a marketing experiment conducted by Keywrb Lab Group in the early 1990s. The goal was to create the illusion of a grassroots environmental movement through false flag TV and radio hijackings with music and visual art. While this project was ultimately defunded, there has recently been some documentation of the experiment resurfacing.
https://open.spotify.com/album/7aR08Te6AyMA65H8rBMvNl?si=r203_ZqqREiG2yI2TVnTEA
Golder is a noise pop artist who combines deep indie roots with explosive contemporary production. He’s based in NYC and plays live with Taj Searles and Jesse Zalk. He recently released his new EP, I’m So Shallow When I Think of Death, which harnesses the glistening chaos he explored in his earlier work and playfully tackles themes of consumerism and mortality.
https://open.spotify.com/album/11e3DbtUTbAv7IlhpveoEn?si=shJV7944TQu_DZn1EhHVJw
rsvp

venue.name: Wonderville
venue.address: Wonderville 1186 Broadway Brooklyn, NY, 11221 United States

events.name: AnimeNEXT 2009: The Found Footage Documentary - 1st Public Screening!
events.description:
The anime con experience of yesteryear packed into a hot wild 80 minutes.
AnimeNEXT 2009: The Found Footage documentary aims to simply evoke the magic of the anime convention golden years via a preserved three day convention experience, nothing more nothing less.
Comprised entirely of old digi-cam footage from an era before everything was manicured for social media & the cell phone camera, the documentary throws you right into the con, forcing all to bask in awe of these bygone, earnest weebs; Heart filled to brim the power of friendship and anime, lacking any and all shame. Most people who've seen the film have laughed, many have cried, a few dubbed it incomprehensible, and one called it absolute dreck!
This is the first time the film will be screened to the public, will it bring you down memory lane or drive you to madness? In anime convention tradition, the documentary screening will be paired with a couple of classic anime con panels so get there early!: Anime Burger Time by Evan Minto (Azuki.co, Ani-Gamers) The Great Gundam Gebate, featuring a panel of Newtype Level Gundam Nerds. We encourage old cosplay and kigurumi's to this totally free event!
Hope you join us Sunday, March 16th from 2PM to 5PM!
RSVP

venue.name: Wonderville
venue.address: Wonderville 1186 Broadway Brooklyn, NY, 11221 United States

events.name: GLHF! VGM and Digital Fusion Party
events.description:
A wild night of video game music, math rock, digital fusion and beyond. Join four new voices on the cutting edge of a new scene in Brooklyn.
GLHF - GLHF (Good Luck Have Fun) is a raucous party band specializing in fast-paced and layered synth-rock, jazz fusion, and hyperpop remixes of video game music, often mashed with music from anime and pop/internet culture. Led by Joe Etzine and featuring VGM giants including Dom Palombi, Khrys Williams, and others who have frequented the mainstages of Magfest and PAX East, GLHF is currently playing shows across the East Coast.
Visit
https://linktr.ee/jetzine
for clips and social media.
Maxo - Max Coburn, often under the name ‘Maxo’ is a musician and sound designer from Brooklyn, New York who specializes in digitally produced music, channelling a wide array of style and influence from Jazz, to Digital Fusion, to various types of dance music and beyond.
Visit
http://maxo.audio
Redddaz - is the spirit of Brooklyn in one man. This melting pot of American, Afro-Caribbean, and Afro-Latino cultures is not only the foundation of his music, but also his plane ticket to the rest of the world. Understanding that music ties us all together, this songwriter and producer seeks to bring a little piece of Brooklyn on his travels around the globe.
Visit
http://www.redddaz.com
Teal Jay - Fronted by Tyler Lee Jones, Teal Jay is a Brooklyn-based math rock project centered around their overhand guitar technique. They're influenced by artists in the NY/NJ indie emo/math punk and adjacent scenes (Invalids, Use Big Words, The Best of the Worst) as well as early 2000's J-rock/J-punk (STANE PUNKS, Sambomaster, AKFG).
Visit
linktr.ee/tylerleejones
Buy Tickets

Our songwriting system, THE WEIRD ALGORITHM, matches each line syllable-for-syllable, so you can sing along if you know the original tune.
Request any of the 100+ songs and 50+ texts in the catalog. Sign up to sing as an individual or a group...or sit back and watch the karaoke carnage.
Past combos include:
YELP REVIEWS OF PSYCHICS to the tune of TOTAL ECLIPSE OF THE HEART
CRAIGSLIST VEHICLE ADS to the tune of TAKE ME HOME COUNTRY ROADS
NEGATIVE REVIEWS OF PROFESSORS to the tune of VAMPIRE
BERNIE SANDERS EMAIL SUBJECT LINES to the tune of DON'T STOP BELIEVIN'
Hosted by Jamie Brew and Jenn Schiffer, two tech entrepreneurs on a mission to make karaoke harder and worse.
Free admission
Suggested donation - $10
rsvp

🔥 Let it Rip!
The Ultimate Beyblade X Tournament is Here! 🔥 Get ready to spin, clash, and dominate in the Beyblade X Tournament, where the best Bladers will battle for glory!
Whether you're a seasoned competitor or a rising star, this is your chance to prove your skills in the ultimate high-speed showdown. 🏆 Tournament Highlights: Intense Battles: Face off against top Bladers in high-speed, high-energy matches.
Official Beyblade X Format: Experience the fast-paced action of the latest Beyblade X system. Prizes & Glory: Compete for exclusive Beyblade X prizes and the title of Champion! Community & Fun: Meet fellow Bladers, trade tips, and enjoy an electrifying atmosphere. 📅
Think you have what it takes to be the ultimate Blader? Grab your Beys, fine-tune your launch, and Let it Rip! 🚀 #BeybladeX #LetItRip #BeybladeTournament

Whether you want more Scrapeboard, missed out on playing at MAGFest, or are just looking to vibe  at Wonderville's indie arcade and bar —

NIGHT!

events.name: {LIVESTREAM} FORT90 FILM CLUB presents: "IT'S COMPLICATED'
events.description:
Live, from Twitch dot TV forward slash __________, it's the FORT90 FILM CLUB! And it's February, and love is once again in the air, or at least it's supposed to be. But it like so many things, especially these days, is needlessly complicated. For example, I will be showing a movie that helped me fall in love with Hong Kong cinema way back in the day, but nowadays, I find my memories of such strong sentimentality kinda embarrassing to be honest! Said film is party of the line-up, goes without saying of course.
Watch on Twitch

venue.name: Wonderville
venue.address: Wonderville 1186 Broadway Brooklyn, NY, 11221 United States

events.name: Tackycardia: 2 Year Anniversary
events.description:
Well well well another year of Tackycardia in the books. Massive appreciation to everyone who has supported us over these last couple of years whether it’s artists we’ve booked, VJs, flyer designers, staff at Wonderville, or y’all who just serially show up and dance/game. We very much weren’t expecting for things to last this long when we started this little experiment out but here we are heading into year 3 of 150+ bpm fuckery!
Here’s what we’ve got for ya for our anniversary. Tackycardia alum DJ Allegation will be returning following appearances at Silo and Bossa Nova Civic Club. In addition, New England legend Jack McDevitt (also of Disco Ball Murder Kit) will be making the trek into NYC to treat us with some fresh sounds. Arpanette comes through following appearances at Eris and Café Kitsuné. Boj joins us following appearances at Happyfun Hideaway and the Cuff Complex while Tailz who heads Blast NYC comes following appearances at Eris, Trans Pecos and Hart Bar. The card will be rounded out by Tackycardia residents Cryostatik who recently put out 2 new tunes in Mess ‘Em Up and Solace as well as Alex Viper who is fresh off of December appearances at Tropical Dreams festival and Garage Sale in Massachusetts in addition to the Stuck on Earth reunion event in NYC. As usual not all of our lineup is known for their high BPM antics so we’re just as excited as y’all are to see what fantastic sets come out. Getting DJs and audiences alike a tad out of their comfort zones is one of our favorite things about doing these events and we are gonna keep it up :) Make sure to follow our instagram @tackcyardia_nyc as we’ll be posting a bit more about our artists in the lead up to the event!
We look forward to celebrating the occasion with y’all. As usual it’s a 150+ genrefluid affair with free entry and free to play arcade games. Donations are welcome to further support our events and can be made via cash in the tip bucket on the stage or via venmo through our QR code that you’ll see posted around the venue. Here’s to another year!
rsvp

venue.name: Wonderville
venue.address: Wonderville 1186 Broadway Brooklyn, NY, 11221 United States

events.name: SeeToAct.org Yearly Fundraiser
events.description:
SeeToAct.org
is a non-profit organization that teaches storytelling and filmmaking vocations to incarcerated teenagers to provide them with life skills to pursue a career in film without having to attend a university. Various artists will be donating their time for the annual fundraiser which will include performances, film presentations, and a raffle, consisting of a live painting from the show & various pieces of other prizes. The show is $10 and all the proceeds go directly to SeeToAct. 21+
It starts at 07:00p and goes until 12:00a-12:30ish.
The lineup is as follows, but order is subject to change for the event:
SHARKSWIMMER
Special Guest
AR Immortal
VVanentina
Metic
Isaac Saywer
Brook Laialoha
King John Ill
A.Sarr
Confident Baby
Scenario
Please join us for a very special evening and support underserved youth in need.
buy tickets

events.name: KQ Wonderville Monthly BYOT (Bring Your Own Team)!
events.description:
Watch some of the best Killer Queen players bring teams and face off in a tournament of the popular and fast-paced ten player strategy arcade platformer 🐝👑⚔️ while enjoying good company and, if you like, a dish to share to enjoy some good food! Or just bring yourself and your excitement for cheering on your favorite teams!
Sign Up Here

events.name: Killer Queen Open Hive Night
events.description:
Every Wednesday is Killer Queen Freeplay Night! Come learn how to play the popular 10-player arcade game from some of NYC’s best players!
Each week there is a tournament. Sign ups are at 8pm, tournament commences at 8:30pm. Make new friends, learn to play Killer Queen!

venue.name: Wonderville
venue.address: Wonderville 1186 Broadway Brooklyn, NY, 11221 United States

events.name: Wonderville's Last Tuesday of the month PLAYTEST
events.description:
Playtest Night is EVERY last Tuesday of EVERY month at Wonderville!
Come to Wonderville to playtest in production games!
If you're a developer, bring your game! No signups required.
rsvp

venue.name: Wonderville

events.name: {livestream} FORT90 FILM CLUB presents: "DESPERATE MEASURES" (part 2)
events.description:
Live, from Twitch dot TV forward slash __________, it's the FORT90 FILM CLUB! The first edition for the year 2025, which is already shaping up to be the absolute worst year in our collective lifetimes. So with that in mind, what should we do about it? How about a bunch of movies featuring totally desperate times and the totally desperate measures that some decided to undertake?
Watch on Twitch

events.name: Welcome to Club: ???
events.description:
Hosted at the wacky arcade @wondervillenyc, Club: ??? is an open format party housed at the wacky arcade where anything goes. The series will showcase some of the city’s most creative and dynamic musicians and center experimentation, exploration, and whimsy in an unconventional setting outside of a classic club or music venue. At any given event, there may be DJ sets, beat sets, rappers, live instruments, and more.
For the first edition, curator @
kweku.nyc
will be joined by @cjf2002_ @pizzaqueenhaley @1ateshia, all DJs who like to go all over the place with their sets, pulling from a wide variety of genres and leaving crowds guessing what’s next. Release your expectations, and come dance with us.
rsvp

events.name: TeddyBeats and Friends
events.description:
Armada Music producer and DJ Teddy Beats is bringing his chill deep house sound, regularly featured on SiriusXM, to New York City for the first time at Wonderville in Brooklyn on January 24th, along side supporting DJs Etomo and Diego James.
